segments.text: I'm so hungry . Shall we go eat now , Rick ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . Where do you want to go ? Are you in the mood for anything in particular ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How about some dumplings ? I just can't get enough of them .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Dumplings again ? ! Oh , Amy , let's try something new !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , what do you have in mind ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How about the Mongolian hot pot ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , it's too spicy for me . Don't you remember last time when I tasted the lamb ? It Was so spicy my eyes teared up !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Maybe we can try ' Yuanyang pot ' this time . You can choose the non-spicy soup base .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sounds great . Do they serve noodles ? I am in the mood for some tasty noodles as well .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . The sliced noodles they offer are among the most authentic Shanti cuisines .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Wait a minute . Let me throw on a sweater .
segments.speaker: S2
